verses.verse: Now these<WH428> are the nations<WH1471> which<WH834> the Lord<WH3068> left,<WH5117> to test<WH5254> Israel<WH3478> by them ([that is,] all<WH3605> who<WH834> had not experienced<WH3045> any<WH3605> of the wars<WH4421> of Canaan;<WH3667>

And the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> lived<WH3427> among<WH7130> the Canaanites,<WH3669> the Hittites,<WH2850> the Amorites,<WH567> the Perizzites,<WH6522> the Hivites,<WH2340> and the Jebusites;<WH2983>
and they took<WH3947> their daughters<WH1323> for themselves as wives,<WH802> and gave<WH5414> their own daughters<WH1323> to their sons,<WH1121> and served<WH5647> their gods.<WH430>

And the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> did<WH6213> what<WH7451> was evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the Lord,<WH3068> and forgot<WH7911> the Lord<WH3068> their God,<WH430> and served<WH5647> the Baals<WH1168> and the Asheroth.<WH842>

Then the anger<WH639> of the Lord<WH3068> was kindled<WH2734> against Israel,<WH3478> so that He sold<WH4376> them into the hands<WH3027> of Cushan-rishathaim king<WH4428> of Mesopotamia;<WH763> and the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> served<WH5647> Cushan-rishathaim eight<WH8083> years.<WH8141>

And when the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> cried<WH2199> to the Lord,<WH3068> the Lord<WH3068> raised<WH6965> up a deliverer<WH3467> for the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> to deliver<WH3467> them, Othniel<WH6274> the son<WH1121> of Kenaz,<WH7073> Caleb's younger<WH9512> brother.<WH251>

And the Spirit<WH7307> of the Lord<WH3068> came<WH1961> upon him, and he judged<WH8199> Israel.<WH3478> When he went<WH3318> out to war,<WH4421> the Lord<WH3068> gave<WH5414> Cushan-rishathaim king<WH4428> of Mesopotamia<WH763> into his hand,<WH3027> so that he prevailed<WH5810> <WH3027> over<WH5921> Cushan-rishathaim.
Then the land<WH776> had<WH8252> rest<WH8252> forty<WH705> years.<WH8141> And Othniel<WH6274> the son<WH1121> of Kenaz<WH7073> died.<WH4191>

Now the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> again<WH3254> did<WH6213> evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the Lord.<WH3068> So the Lord<WH3068> strengthened<WH2388> Eglon<WH5700> the king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124> against<WH5921> Israel,<WH3478> because<WH5921> <WH3588> they had done<WH6213> evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the Lord.<WH3068>

And he gathered<WH622> to himself the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> and Amalek;<WH6002> and he went<WH1980> and defeated<WH5221> Israel,<WH3478> and they possessed<WH3423> the city<WH5892> of the palm<WH8558> trees.<WH8558>
And the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> served<WH5647> Eglon<WH5700> the king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124> eighteen<WH8083> <WH6240> years.<WH8141>

But when the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> cried<WH2199> to the Lord,<WH3068> the Lord<WH3068> raised<WH6965> up a deliverer<WH3467> for them, Ehud<WH164> the son<WH1121> of Gera,<WH1617> the Benjamite,<WH1145> a left-handed man.<WH376> And the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> sent<WH7971> tribute<WH4503> by him to Eglon<WH5700> the king<WH4428> of Moab.<WH4124>

And Ehud<WH164> made<WH6213> himself a sword<WH2719> which had two<WH8147> edges,<WH6310> a cubit<WH1574> in length;<WH753> and he bound<WH2296> it on his right<WH3225> thigh<WH3409> under<WH8478> his cloak.<WH4055>
And he presented<WH7126> the tribute<WH4503> to Eglon<WH5700> king<WH4428> of Moab.<WH4124> Now Eglon<WH5700> was a very<WH3966> fat<WH1277> man.<WH376>

And it came<WH1961> about when<WH9201> he had finished<WH3615> presenting<WH7126> the tribute,<WH4503> that he sent<WH7971> away<WH7971> the people<WH5971> who had carried<WH5375> the tribute.<WH4503>

But he himself<WH1931> turned<WH7725> back<WH7725> from the idols<WH6456> which<WH834> were at Gilgal,<WH1537> and said,<WH559> "I have a secret<WH5643> message<WH1697> for you, O king.<WH4428>" And he said,<WH559> "Keep<WH2013> silence.<WH2013>" And all<WH3605> who attended<WH5975> him left<WH3318> him.

And Ehud<WH164> came<WH935> to him while he was sitting<WH3427> alone<WH905> in his cool<WH4747> roof<WH5944> chamber.<WH5944> And Ehud<WH164> said,<WH559> "I have a message<WH1697> from God<WH430> for you." And he arose<WH6965> from his seat.<WH3678>
And Ehud<WH164> stretched<WH7971> out his left<WH8040> hand,<WH8040> took<WH3947> the sword<WH2719> from his right<WH3225> thigh<WH3409> and thrust<WH8628> it into his belly.<WH990>

The handle<WH5325> also<WH1571> went<WH935> in after<WH310> the blade,<WH3851> and the fat<WH2459> closed<WH5462> over<WH5704> the blade,<WH3851> for he did not draw<WH8025> the sword<WH2719> out of his belly;<WH990> and the refuse<WH6574> came<WH3318> out.
Then Ehud<WH164> went<WH3318> out into the vestibule<WH4528> and shut<WH5462> the doors<WH1817> of the roof<WH5944> chamber<WH5944> behind<WH1157> him, and locked<WH5274> [them].

When he had gone<WH3318> out, his servants<WH5650> came<WH935> and looked,<WH7200> and behold,<WH2009> the doors<WH1817> of the roof<WH5944> chamber<WH5944> were locked;<WH5274> and they said,<WH559> "He is only<WH389> relieving<WH5526> <WH7272> himself in the cool<WH4747> room.<WH2315>"

And they waited<WH9123> until<WH5704> they became<WH954> anxious;<WH954> but behold,<WH2009> he did not open<WH6605> the doors<WH1817> of the roof<WH5944> chamber.<WH5944> Therefore they took<WH3947> the key<WH4668> and opened<WH6605> them, and behold,<WH2009> their master<WH113> had fallen<WH5307> to the floor<WH776> dead.<WH4191>
Now Ehud<WH164> escaped<WH4422> while<WH5704> they were delaying,<WH4102> and he passed<WH5674> by the idols<WH6456> and escaped<WH4422> to Seirah.<WH8167>

And it came<WH1961> about when he had arrived,<WH935> that he blew<WH8628> the trumpet<WH7782> in the hill<WH2022> country<WH2022> of Ephraim;<WH669> and the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> went<WH3381> down<WH3381> with him from the hill<WH2022> country,<WH2022> and he [was] in front<WH6440> of them.

And he said<WH559> to them, "Pursue<WH7291> [them], for the Lord<WH3068> has given<WH5414> your enemies<WH340> the Moabites<WH4124> into your hands.<WH3027>" So they went<WH3381> down<WH3381> after<WH310> him and seized<WH3920> the fords<WH9278> of the Jordan<WH3383> opposite Moab,<WH4124> and did not allow<WH5414> anyone<WH376> to cross.<WH5674>

And they struck<WH5221> down<WH5221> at that time<WH6256> about ten<WH6235> thousand<WH505> Moabites,<WH4124> all<WH3605> robust<WH8082> and valiant<WH2428> men;<WH376> and no<WH3808> one<WH376> escaped.<WH4422>
So Moab<WH4124> was subdued<WH3665> that day<WH3117> under<WH8478> the hand<WH3027> of Israel.<WH3478> And the land<WH776> was undisturbed<WH8252> for eighty<WH8084> years.<WH8141>

And after<WH310> him came<WH1961> Shamgar<WH8044> the son<WH1121> of Anath,<WH6067> who struck<WH5221> down<WH5221> six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> Philistines<WH6430> with an oxgoad;<WH4451> and he also<WH1571> saved<WH3467> Israel.<WH3478>
